content: Homepage - Mohammad Ashiqur Rahman Close Mohammad Ashiqur Rahman Education Research External Grants Publications Books and Book Chapters Journal Papers Conference Papers More Peer-Reviewed Papers Research Group News/Events ACyD Lab Close I am an associate professor in the Knight Foundation School of Computing and Information Sciences at Florida International University (FIU). I also have a secondary appointment in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering. I joined FIU as an Assistant Professor in Spring 2019. Before joining FIU, I was with the Department of Computer Science at Tennessee Tech University. I obtained a Ph.D. in computing and information systems from the University of North Carolina at Charlotte in 2015 under the supervision of Prof. Ehab Al-Shaer. Previously, I received BS and MS degrees in computer science and engineering from Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET), Dhaka, in 2004 and 2007, respectively. I lead the Analytics of Cyber Defense (ACyD) Lab at FIU. I am a senior member of IEEE and a member of ACM. You can see my curriculum vitae for further information. Contact Info: Email: marahman [at] fiu [dot] eduOffice: EC 3955, Engineering Center Research Areas My primary research interest covers a wide area of security and dependability problems in cyber and cyber-physical systems (CPSs)/ Internet of Things (IoT). My research focus primarily includes: Computer and information security analysis Control loop security analysis Risk assessment and security design Resiliency analysis and hardening Secure and dependable resource allocation I primarily apply formal methods, artificial intelligence, and game theory in my research. Prospective Students The students should be comfortable with programming, algorithms, and logic, and received BS/MS with a major in Computer Science/Engineering or Electrical/Communication Engineering. Preferred qualities include scholarly publications, especially in cybersecurity, IoT/CPS, or adversarial machine learning. For further information, please go here. News & Events Recent .........
